summary:
GTA 6 Release: Anticipation & Excitement Still Driving Fans As The Waiting For Fall Of 2025 Continues

Published at: 29 Dec 2024 01:39 PM (IST)

Source: ABP Live

The gaming community remains incredibly excited for GTA 6, even as they await more updates from Rockstar Games, with a confirmed release window set for fall 2025.

  • GTA 6 will initially launch exclusively on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S.
  • PC gamers may need to wait until 2026 for their version.
  • The game features a two-protagonist narrative.
  • The fictional city of Leonida, inspired by Florida, will be the main setting, including key locations like Vice City.
  • The first trailer was released in September last year, igniting intense anticipation among fans.
“During an earnings call in November, Rockstar’s parent company, Take-Two Interactive, reaffirmed that GTA 6 is on schedule for a launch in the fall of 2025.”

The anticipation for GTA 6 continues to build as fans count down to its release, making it one of the most awaited games in history.

Samsung Vs Apple: How Samsung Can Gain a Lead Over Apple in 2025

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: News24

As the tech landscape shifts, Samsung faces challenges in standing out against Apple, particularly in regard to new AI features and innovation.

  • Samsung's recent phones struggle to differentiate themselves in a crowded market.
  • AI advancements from Apple have put pressure on Samsung to innovate.
  • The company has been criticized for lacking new and exciting designs.
  • Historical issues with product launch controversies have led Samsung to play it safe.
  • They need to evolve their product design and user interface to attract consumers.
  • Weight and balance issues have been noted in their flagship devices.

In conclusion, Samsung's path to regain market leadership hinges on innovation, addressing consumer feedback, and the strategic integration of AI features.

title: Apple discontinues 3 iPhones, including iPhone 14, in certain markets - India TV News
summary:
Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and Other Models in Europe

Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

Apple has decided to halt the sale of the iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, and iPhone SE (3rd generation) in many European countries, due to regulatory changes mandated by the European Union.

  • The sale is suspended in several countries including Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Germany, France, and more.
  • This decision is in compliance with the EU regulation requiring devices to use USB Type-C ports instead of the Lightning connector.
  • Apple is clearing its inventory of the affected models globally, even in non-EU countries like Switzerland.
  • The iPhone 17 Air is expected to launch in September 2025, showcasing Apple's continued innovation.
"This initiative was aimed at reducing electronic waste..."

The discontinuation reflects Apple's compliance with EU regulations and hints at its future product developments.
newTitle: Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and Other Models in Europe

ChatGPT Search Manipulated With Hidden Instructions - Search Engine Journal
summary:
ChatGPT Search Manipulated With Hidden Instructions

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Guardian

A new report highlights vulnerabilities in ChatGPT Search, demonstrating how hidden text can alter its responses.

  • The Guardian used hidden text to manipulate ChatGPT Search responses.
  • Tests showed that even without explicit instructions, hidden text could skew ChatGPT's outputs.
  • Security experts warn that OpenAI was informed of these exploits.
  • RAG technology poses risks as it influences how AI searches determine authoritative sources.
  • Researchers outlined nine strategies for influencing AI search engine results.
“...when hidden text included instructions to ChatGPT to return a favourable review, the response was always entirely positive.”

This report raises critical concerns about the security and reliability of AI technologies like ChatGPT Search, calling for immediate attention to address the manipulation risks.
newTitle: Manipulation of ChatGPT Search Exposed by New Report

title: Amazon Prime Gaming to Launch Black Myth: Wukong for Free to All Prime Users - ThePhilox
summary:
Amazon Prime Gaming to Offer Black Myth: Wukong for Free

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Unknown

Amazon Prime Gaming is rumored to potentially offer the highly anticipated game Black Myth: Wukong for free to its subscribers, stirring excitement in the gaming community.

What is Black Myth: Wukong?

Black Myth: Wukong is an upcoming action RPG developed by Game Science, based on the Chinese novel Journey to the West. Players will control Sun Wukong and utilize his legendary powers.

Why Is the Hype So Huge?

  • Visual Fidelity: The game showcases stunning graphics and fluid animations.
  • Thrilling Combat System: Features fast-paced martial arts combat and mythical transformations.
  • Cultural Origins: Offers a unique insight into Chinese mythology.

Community Reaction

While many gamers are excited, some express concerns about potential monetization changes.

What It Means for Amazon Prime Gaming

  • Attraction of Gamers: A potential surge in subscriptions.
  • Competition with Rivals: Setting new standards against Xbox Game Pass and PlayStation Plus.
  • New Benchmark for Subscription Services: A shift in how AAA titles might be distributed in the future.

The gaming community eagerly awaits confirmation regarding these rumors and what it would mean for the future of subscription gaming services.
newTitle: Amazon Prime Gaming to Offer Black Myth: Wukong for Free

My Favorite Phones Of 2024, Ranked - Forbes
summary:
My Favorite Phones Of 2024, Ranked

Publication Date: N/A

Source: N/A

This article provides a personal ranking of the author's favorite flagship phones of 2024, highlighting notable features and use cases for each device.

  1. Vivo X200 Pro & X100 Ultra: Exceptional cameras with a 200-megapixel Periscope zoom lens. Excellent image processing. Powerful hardware.
  2. Huawei Mate XT: World's first double-folding phone. Excellent for portability but expensive and limited by software.
  3. Honor Magic V3: Thinnest and lightest foldable phone. Superior design compared to competitors.
  4. Xiaomi 14 Ultra: Innovative camera features. Excellent hardware.
  5. Oppo Find X8 Pro: Impressive design and camera button usability. Smooth software experience.
  6. iPhone 16 Pro Max: New image processing engine. Powerful hardware. Limited customization.
  7. Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra: Polished functionality. Excellent for business use but lacks in camera advancements compared to Chinese brands.

“2024 was a great year for phones, and I wonder about 2025.”

The author's list reflects a mix of personal preference and technical features that underscore the evolution of smartphones, particularly in photography and user experience.

EU universal charger rules come into force - The Hindu
summary:
EU Universal Charger Rules Take Effect

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The European Union's new regulations mandating a common charger for all smartphones, tablets, and cameras have come into force, a move aimed at reducing costs and electronic waste.

  • All new devices sold in the EU must now feature a USB-C charging port.
  • This change is expected to simplify life for consumers and cut down on the number of obsolete chargers.
  • The law was initially approved in 2022 and gives laptop manufacturers until early 2026 to comply.
  • Apple, initially resistant, has started adopting the new charging standard.
"It's time for THE charger," the European Commission stated, emphasizing the benefits of reduced e-waste.

This significant step by the EU seeks to encourage consistency across the tech industry, benefiting consumers while addressing environmental concerns.
newTitle: EU Universal Charger Rules Take Effect

Apple Pulls iPhone 14 and SE from Europe as USB-C Mandate Changes the Game - The Economic Times
summary:
Apple Pulls iPhone 14 and SE from Europe as USB-C Mandate Changes the Game

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Feed

Apple has made a major move by discontinuing sales of the iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, and iPhone SE (3rd generation) in 29 European countries as part of compliance with a new EU regulation mandating USB-C charging ports for all electronic devices.

  • The decision impacts 29 countries in Europe.
  • The move aims to reduce electronic waste and standardize charging ports.
  • Third-party retailers may still have stock available temporarily.
  • Sales of iPhone SE are declining as a new model is anticipated in Spring 2025.
“Apple has removed these models from its official store, third-party retailers may still sell remaining stocks.”

Apple's shift to USB-C began with the iPhone 15 series, and older models using the Lightning connector have been phased out due to non-compliance with EU regulations.
newTitle: Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and SE in Europe Due to USB-C Mandate
